questions.text: Is climate action the core purpose or goal of the policy?
questions.answer: The policy under review, titled 'Zero Carbon Merri-bek – Climate Emergency Action Plan 2020/21 – 2024/25', clearly identifies climate action as its core purpose. The policy outlines a comprehensive plan to address climate change, with a focus on reducing greenhouse gas emissions and transitioning to a zero-carbon society. The policy acknowledges the climate emergency and outlines a series of actions and initiatives aimed at mobilising the community, businesses, and government to respond to this crisis. These actions include facilitating community food gardens, installing electric vehicle charging stations, and advocating for state and federal governments to enact key policies for a zero-carbon transition. The policy also sets a goal for Merri-bek to achieve a 75% emissions reduction by 2030. Therefore, it is evident that the core purpose of this policy is climate action.
